title: Steph Claire Smith exposes the reality of 'perfect' Instagram photos
text:
She's the fitness model known for her 'ab-blasting' workouts.

But Steph Claire Smith exposed the truth behind her seemingly perfect Instagram photos on Wednesday, when she shared an alarming before-and-after post.

The Keep It Cleaner co-founder, 25, uploaded two photos of herself taken just days apart, which highlighted how bloating can affect one's appearance.

Scroll down for video

'I'm puffy one day and lean the next': On Wednesday, Steph Claire Smith shared before-and-after photos that highlighted the effect of bloating on her physique

The 'before' photo showed Steph with a noticeably rounded stomach due to bloating, while the 'after' photo highlighted her washboard abs.

In the accompanying caption, she emphasised that bloating is perfectly normal and shouldn't cause people to 'question their health'.

'Guess what. We bloat. We fluctuate. We're puffy one day and feeling like lean beans the next. That's life,' she began.

Wise words: In the accompanying caption, Steph emphasised that bloating is perfectly normal and shouldn't cause people to 'question their health'

The model explained that she was 'more bloated than usual' because she was menstruating and 'snacking like crazy'.

Steph then encouraged her 1.5 million Instagram followers to give themselves a break if they find their appearance suddenly shifting.

'Don't let changes stress you out, or question your health or your journey. No matter where you're sitting, even in your healthy weight range you will fluctuate,' she wrote.

'Don't let changes stress you out': Steph encouraged her 1.5 million Instagram followers to give themselves a break if they find their appearance suddenly shifting

This isn't the first time Steph has posted about her changing physique, as earlier this month she 'thanked' her abs for becoming visible.

'Hey abs, thanks for joining me! I know it's always a short visit, you tend to just pop out from time to time, but know that I love you, even when you're hiding,' she wrote on Instagram.

Steph is the co-founder of the popular Keep it Cleaner fitness and health food brand alongside Laura Henshaw.
